channel.title: Quotes of the Day
channel.description: Four humorous quotations each day from The Quotations Page
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Bill Barnes and Gene Ambaum
item.description: "Not every story has explosions and car chases. That's why they have nudity and espionage."

item.title: Emerson Pugh
item.description: "If the human mind was simple enough to understand, we'd be too simple to understand it."

item.title: Mickey Rooney
item.description: "Always get married early in the morning. That way, if it doesn't work out, you haven't wasted a whole day."

item.title: Berton Averre
item.description: "To err is dysfunctional, to forgive co-dependent."

item.title: George Orwell
item.description: "The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns as it were instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish spurting out ink."

item.title: John Wayne
item.description: "Talk low, talk slow, and don't talk too much."

item.title: P. J. O'Rourke
item.description: "The mystery of government is not how Washington works but how to make it stop."

item.title: Orson Welles
item.description: "My doctor told me to stop having intimate dinners for four. Unless there are three other people."

item.title: James Thurber
item.description: "He knows all about art, but he doesn't know what he likes."

item.title: Sydney Smith
item.description: "You must not think me necessarily foolish because I am facetious, nor will I consider you necessarily wise because you are grave."

item.title: Edwin P. Whipple
item.description: "An epigram often flashes light into regions where reason shines but dimly."
